repnme.cdata!:
Tajikistan - Ferghana Valley Water
            Resources Management Project (FVWRMP)

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Ferghana Valley Water
            Resources Management Project (FVWRMP) for Tajikistan were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately unsatisfactory, the risk
            to development outcome was moderate, the Bank performance
            was moderately unsatisfactory, and the Borrower performance
            was also moderately unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: projects need to calculate the volume of works,
            consider seasonal prevalence of works and work out realistic
            costing/budgeting at project preparation and design to avoid
            mistakes. When project implementation requires harmonizing
            the timing with implementation of other projects, teams need
            to identify to identify alternative actions in case of
            possible delays in the other project. FVWRMP spent time to
            convince some farms to implement restructuring, while there
            were other farms that were very keen to restructure. The
            project should have prioritized these farms and proceeded on
            a demand-driven basis at least to begin with restructuring.
            At additional financing and restructuring, FVWRMP included
            the geotechnical study as part of the PDO. This study was a
            complex task that also required greater resources than was
            allocated to the activity. This resulted in the project not
            achieving part of the PDO.

repnme.cdata!:
Tajikistan - Ferghana Valley Water
            Resources Management Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Ferghana Valley
            Water Resources Management Project are: to improve the
            capacity for increased productivity of irrigated agriculture
            in the Ferghana valley by improving land and water
            management, and to improve safety and regulation of the
            Kayrakum dam and reservoir, thereby contributing to enhanced
            water management security and efficiency at the basin level.
            The original closing date was May 31, 2011, which was
            extended to May 31, 2013 when the additional financing was
            approved. It is to extend the closing date by an additional
            year to May 31, 2014. The extension is necessary to complete
            all works and strengthen the Water User Associations (WUAs).
            Construction works can only be implemented during a few
            months per year. As a result of this, some of the works have
            been delayed. It would be challenging to recover these
            delays as only a few months of effective construction time
            remain before the closing date, by which time it is unlikely
            that all works will be completed. This will be the second
            closing date extension for the project for a cumulative
            extension of three years.

display_title.display_title:
Tajikistan - Ferghana Valley
            Water Resources Management Project : restructuring : Main report
